BitcoinAddress.description: Information about a single Bitcoin address.

address.description: Bitcoin Base58-Check or bech32 encoded address.

summary.description: Summary information about this Bitcoin address.

BitcoinAddress.title: BitcoinAddress

BitcoinBlock.description: A single block in the bitcoin blockchain

hash.description: The unique hash that identifies this block.

height.description: The height (distance) of this block from the genesis block (block 0).

medianTime.description:
The median time of this block.

The median time is defined as the median of the time of the previous 11 mined blocks.

minerTime.description: The time that the miner that mined this block attached to this block.

BitcoinBlock.title: BitcoinBlock

BitcoinInput.description: A single input to a Bitcoin Transaction.

addressNames.description: Bitcoin Addresses that are known to be sources for this transaction input.

bitcoinValue.description: The value of this input in BTC.

details.description: Details of this transaction input, if requested.

inputIndex.description: The position of this input within the transaction (e.g., ordinal in vin).

medianTime.description: The medianTime of the block that included the transaction output that this input spends.

minerTime.description: The minerTime of the block that included the transaction output that this input spends.

signatures.description: Number of signatures provided for this input.

transactionName.description: The name of the transaction that supplied this input value.

BitcoinInput.title: BitcoinInput

addressNames.description: For standard transactions, the addresses that can unlock this output.

bitcoinValue.description: This value of this output, in BTC.

medianTime.description: The time from the transaction that consumed this output

minerTime.description: The mining time from the containing block of the transaction that consumed this output

name.description: The addressable name of this output.

outputIndex.description: The index of this output within the transaction.

transactionName.description: @return the name of the transaction that consumed this output value

BitcoinQuery.description:
A search expression over Bitcoin blocks.

A BitcoinQueryExpression can contain either a comparison or grouping query. Comparison queries are standard equality-type comparisons on defined fields of the BlocWatch model. Group queries can be used to create conjunctive or disjunctive sets of comparison queries.

One of group_query or compare_query should be specified, but not both.

compareQuery.description:
A comparison-based query on Bitcoin fields.

The group query and the compare query are exclusive options, only one may set.

groupQuery.description:
A conjunctive (and) or disjunctive (or) query.

The group query and the compare query are exclusive options, only one may set.

BitcoinQuery.title: BitcoinQuery

CreateIteratorRequest.description:
A request to create an iterator. Iterators have multiple types.

FROM_BLOCK_HEIGHT must have fromBlockHeight set FROM_TIMESTAMP must have fromTimestamp set

For FROM_BEGINNING and FROM_CHAIN_TIP no other arguments are necessary.

Optional query can be provided, and will act as a filter on any records that are returned
CreateIteratorRequest.title: CreateIteratorRequest

GetBlockResponse.description: Response to a request to get a single Bitcoin block.
GetBlockResponse.title: GetBlockResponse

GetTransactionInputResponse.description: Response for retrieving a single transaction input

transaction.description: The transaction containing this transaction input.

GetTransactionInputResponse.title: GetTransactionInputResponse

GetTransactionOutputResponse.description: Response for retrieving a single transaction output
GetTransactionOutputResponse.title: GetTransactionOutputResponse

GroupQuery.description: A disjunctive or conjunctive query over Bitcoin blocks.
GroupQuery.title: GroupQuery

InputDetails.description: Details of a single Bitcoin transaction input.

script.description: Unlocking script ASM used for this transaction input.

txWitness.description: List of witnesses, one for each input if this is a SegWit transaction.

InputDetails.title: InputDetails

ListBlockTransactionsResponse.description: The response to list bitcoin transactions from a single block.
ListBlockTransactionsResponse.title: ListBlockTransactionsResponse

ListBlocksResponse.description: Response to request to fetch a list of blocks.
ListBlocksResponse.title: ListBlocksResponse

ListTransactionInputsResponse.description: The response to a request to list bitcoin transactions inputs.

transaction.description: The transaction containing the listed inputs.

ListTransactionInputsResponse.title: ListTransactionInputsResponse

ListTransactionOutputsResponse.description: The response to a request to list bitcoin transaction outputs.

transaction.description: The transaction that contains the listed outputs.

ListTransactionOutputsResponse.title: ListTransactionOutputsResponse

ListTransactionsResponse.description: The response to list bitcoin transactions.
ListTransactionsResponse.title: ListTransactionsResponse

OutputDetails.description: Details for a Bitcoin Transaction Output.

script.description: ASM Locking Script of of this transaction.

scriptType.description: The type of locking script employed.

OutputDetails.title: OutputDetails

TimeWindow.description: Constrain a transaction query around two points in time
TimeWindow.title: TimeWindow

Usage.description:
One usage of a bitcoin address, where the "incoming" transaction has sent value to the address,
 and optionally the "outgoing" transaction has used the value from the address.
Usage.title: Usage

UsageIn.description: Incoming transaction information to address usage (output from transaction).
UsageIn.title: UsageIn

UsageOut.description: Outgoing transaction information from address usage (input to transaction).
UsageOut.title: UsageOut

info.description: The premier crypto API for blockchain analysis
info.title: Blocwatch REST API
